'''''Old Mornings Dawn''''' is the seventh full-length album by [[Summoning]]. The album was released on [[5 June]], [[2013]], through Napalm Records. ''Old Mornings Dawn'' was released seven years after their previous full-length album ''Oath Bound'', which is the longest gap between any Summoning albums. With two bonus tracks contained by the box-set and vinyl versions, this album is Summoning's longest album to date. 

The lyrics for four of the tracks are based on the story of [[Eärendil]] the mariner, ancestor of the kings of [[Númenor]]. The lyrics of two tracks are based on the poems "City of Present Sorrow" and "Town of Dreams", by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. The rest of the lyrics came from unknown writers or were written by the band in a style that fits within the Tolkien universe.
